page.title: 09Housing, Landscape,Buildings
page.content: Rural charm much of our block may have, but for all that stone houses are rare - a mere 3.3%. If you should fancy that country cottage, then Sunniside (2l60) with 26% stone houses is the best bet. The recent vintage of most of our houses is also evident by the small number of slate rooves (l5.2%) - tile being more common. Only in Sunniside (2l60-50%, 2058-35%) is slate still prevalent. In houses built this century shifts in fashion are apparent. On Whickham's new estates (2060) garages (8l%) are nearly as common as gardens (93%). On Lobley Hill's estates (2360) started before the war gardens (9l%) seemed a must for former terrace dwellers but garages (20%) were not yet a necessity. In the block 87% of houses have gardens, 43% have garages.
